cards.caption: Delaware Sens. Tom Carper, left, and Chris Coons

sections: Despite hailing from President Joe Biden’s deep-blue home state, Delaware’s Democratic U.S. senators cast decisive votes in March to help Republicans kill a $15 federal minimum wage initiative. One of those senators, Chris Coons, said during a town hall discussion of the $15 minimum wage last year that he thinks “there are places in the country where that’s too high.”
Coons’ home state, apparently, isn’t one of those places.
Biden is planning a major tax increase on the wealthy.
Sinema’s “Fuck Off” ring isn’t having the effect she likely expected.
A labor union official has scored a key regulatory job.
This is an excerpt from today’s edition of You Love To See It — a weekly subscriber-only feature reviewing good news, progress and action steps. To
